page.title: 19Boating on the River Wye
page.content: As the block is some distance from the sea, the river is a favoured venue for water sports. Two annual raft races are held for amateur rafters and raise large sums of money each year for various charities. They attract entries from all over the country and from all sections of the community. The men's race, held in the spring, is the longer, covering 100 miles from Hay-on-Wye to Chepstow, and extends over three days with overnight camping. The women's race takes place in late summer over a shorter distance from Bridge Sollers to Ross-on-Wye. The design and construction of the rafts is prescribed. Canoeists also use the river, some from a canoeing club in Hereford and some from further afield, even as far as London.
